It is characterized by its finely divided, floating leaves that form a rosette structure, allowing it to thrive in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. Its reproductive structures include small, inconspicuous flowers that develop into fruits containing single seeds. Lepidomicrosorium subhastatum plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms and contributing to water filtration.
